# Ps5: Rmarkdown, basic plots

## Load and check data

1.
```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
```

2.
```{r, message=FALSE}
gap <- read_delim("Data/gapminder.csv.bz2")
gap %>% 
  dim()
```
There is `r nrow(gap)` rows and `r ncol(gap)` columns in the data.

3. 

```{r}
gap %>% 
  sample_n(10)
```
There are no issues with the data.
